release.action: Upgrade to StatCVS 0.7.0.
Automatic shortening of page URL, using bit.ly javascript for Twitter integration.
Reduce scope for the Builder (might save some memory).
Add anonymize to Ant Task.
Add new report for 12m Rolling Developer report.
Add ability to MERGE 2 users through the config-file user.[userName].replacedBy=[newUserName]
A bit of fun, added links to Twitter. In the statsvn.properties file defining the user, See manual
Charts are now configurable, See manual

Through StatCVS, a few cool Twitter features to either have links to your Twitter profile, widgets (see this page) or to be able to Tweet some StatSVN stats straight from the StatSVN generated pages (see this page).
Fixed issue when the only change was a property change.
Fixed issue in command line help with regards to -concurrency-threshold
Add charset option on command line.
Add maillist as Nabble forums.
Added support for an XML export of the main reports, just use option -xml, based on patched proposed by Nilendra Weerasinghe.
Applied patch for [ 1639462 ] Added TRAC Support.
Applied patch to StatCVS to show the Head Revision (had to change it to hide it for CVS as it does not make sense for CVS).
The RepoMap and LOCChurn reports have been promoted to StatCVS and hence, removed from the StatSVN source tree.
Performance enhancement. If SVN 1.4 is available, do one diff per revision instead of one diff per file per revision. Added -force-legacy-diff option to retain previous functionality.
Applied patch to StatCVS to add Affected files count per commit.
Applied patch to StatCVS to add Revision number on commit page.
I have added a validation mechanism that checks the Repository object once the log is parsed, if root is null, it will terminate the execution.
I have added a small project attribute which makes it more obvious which cache belongs to what project in the repositories.xml and xml cache files.
Added support for tags-dir as a way to specify 'top' directory where the tags are stored, defaulted to "/tags/".
Changed RSS to use the common one: http://feeds.feedburner.com/ObjectlabOpenSourceNews
Added support for a '-anonymize' command line option, to anonymize committer names.
Fix an issue in detecting tags that may be further down than the root directory of the log. Also use the tag pattern earlier on in the log parser, so only required tags will be considered.
Exclude pattern is now used also for the diffs (avoid attempting to svn diff '.htaccess' at all cost!).
Fixing url encoded module name.
Added EnvReport function to aid in identifying common failure cases (no change to StatSVN command line, it is a seperate executable class).
Added introduction page for demos.
Support the tags command line parameter (will only show a given set of tags).
Removed JDK 1.5 dependency on String.replace(CharSequence,CharSequence).
Fixed an NPE in RepoPageMaker (only happening if repo has no dates.
Improved reporting of XML parsing errors.
Changed the Maven dependencies to use a backport concurrent compiled with jdk 1.4
Fixed a glitch for SvnInfoUtils.urlToAbsolutePath path mangling

release.description: Maintenance, concurrent diff, new RepoMap and Loc/Churn Reports
release.action: Included a small fix in StatCVS (just post 0.3 release) in order to avoid NPE with Ant for ViewCVS integration.
Earlier fix did not work on all operating systems; our support for spaces in filenames no longer causes problems.
Ant task was broken in 0.2.0; fixed and changed to use same conventions as StatCVS
Fixed a mime-type problem discovered when running StatSVN on Widelands project.
Fixed a number of issues related to the LOC for files that have been moved or directories moved and/or deleted.
The error report highlighted an issue with filenames containing space(s) in the svn diff call.
New Report: LOC and Churn shows the usual LOC with the amount of code touched per day. Hopefully the churn should go decreasingly towards a release.

New Report: Repo Map, a jtreemap-based report (applet) that shows the entire source tree in a hierarchical manner, the size of each box is related to LOC and the colour to the changes over the last 30 days (red -loc, green +loc).

Adding basic support for Symbolic Names (i.e. tags). You MUST get a log at the top level of the project, not the trunk level, e.g.: svn log -v --xml https://svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/statsvn/ That way, the log will contain some information about the tags. At the moment, StatSVN only works with "/tags/" directory.
Patch for upgrade to StatCVS 0.3.0-dev.
Removed 1.5-specific code.
Removed 1.5-specific code.
Overhaul of the SVN Diff to use multiple threads if required. Command line parameters -threads (default 25) and -concurrency-threshold (default 2000 ms) added.
Upgrade dependency to statcvs-0.3 which allows extra reports to be integrated.
Patch to fix issue:running tests doesn't work because writing to /root/.statsvn is not allowed.
Adding a counter for the number of diff calls made and to be made, save the cache every 2 minutes (takes 15ms) and provides an estimate for completion time.

release.description: Removing the StatCvs code from StatSVN
release.action: Removing the StatCvs code from StatSVN
Fixed issues related to InputStream from svn command line executions
Acted on FindBugs, PMD and Checkstyle warnings.
Fixed issue related to number of files when they are moved/deleted.

release.description: XDoc support and move to net.sf.statsvn
release.action: Added support for xdoc.
Moved code to net.sf.statsvn in preparation of removing the code that belongs to StatCvs.
